dcterms:creator: M. Liwicki
H. Bunke
dcterms:description: The IAM-OnDB dataset is the most used evaluation dataset for online handwriting recognition. It consists of 298,523 characters in 86,272 word instances from a dictionary of 11,059 words using 79 different characters written by 221 writers.
dcterms:title: IAM-OnDB

dcterms:creator: C.-L. Liu
F. Yin
D.-H. Wang
Q.-F. Wang
dcterms:description: The CASIA database contains 2,693,183 samples for training and 224,590 samples for testing, produced by different writers. The number of character classes is 3,755.
dcterms:title: CASIA

dcterms:creator: D. Keysers
T. Deselaers
H. Rowley
L.-L. Wang
V. Carbune
dcterms:description: In-house datasets consist of data collected through prompting, commercially available data, artificially inflated data, and labeled/self-labeled anonymized recognition requests.
dcterms:title: In-house datasets
